<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">On February&nbsp;28, 2013, Messrs. Atkins, 
Mengle and Isaac met with Mr.&nbsp;Juneau and
Kyle Johns of Juneau Exploration L.P. (&#147;Juneau Exploration&#148;) regarding
Contango&#146;s Tuscaloosa Marine Shale position and sidetrack opportunities in 
Contango&#146;s Dutch / Mary Rose field. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">On March&nbsp;1, 2013, Morgan Lewis sent an 
initial draft of a merger agreement and form of support agreement to 
Vinson&nbsp;&amp;
Elkins. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-
indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">On March&nbsp;4, 
2013, representatives from Morgan Lewis and Contango&#146;s land consultant, 
FOP, met with
representatives of Crimson at Crimson&#146;s offices to commence their due 
diligence review of title to Crimson&#146;s oil and gas properties and material 
contracts relating thereto. This review continued for several weeks following 
this meeting.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT 
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">On March&nbsp;5, 2013, Messrs. 
Keel, Grady and Thomas met with representatives of Vinson&nbsp;&amp; Elkins to 
discuss the
typical process and issues associated with public-company strategic business 
combinations such as the transaction contemplated by Contango and Crimson as 
well as the fiduciary duties of the members of Crimson&#146;s board of directors
in connection
therewith. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-
indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Also on March 5, 
2013, Petrie shared with Crimson and Barclays updated prospective financial 
information of
Contango on a standalone basis for the years 2013 through 2017 prepared based on
the then current Cobb &amp; Associates proved reserve report and discussions 
with Contango&#146;s management team. The analysis also included a preliminary 
analysis of
pro forma financial information of the combined company. </FONT></P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">On March&nbsp;6, 2013, Messrs. Atkins, Mengle, 
Isaac and Grady met
with Messrs. Romano and Juneau regarding Contango&#146;s interest in the Exaro 
and Alta joint ventures. At this meeting, Mr.&nbsp;Juneau also provided an 
update on the status of Contango&#146;s ongoing workover of its Vermilion 170 
well. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">On March&nbsp;7, 2013, Mr.&nbsp;Thomas and 
attorneys from Vinson&nbsp;&amp; Elkins and Morgan Lewis met at 
Vinson&nbsp;&amp; Elkins&#146;
offices in Houston, Texas, regarding the structuring of the potential 
transaction, potential timeline, diligence matters and governance. Also on this 
date, Messrs. Keel and Grady met with representatives of Barclays to continue 
discussing the
proposed strategic business combination with Contango and the timeline 
associated therewith. During those discussions, Crimson formally engaged 
Barclays as its financial advisor for the merger. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">On March&nbsp;8, 2013, Mr.&nbsp;Romano met with
Jim Ford, a representative of Oaktree Management, and a member of Crimson&#146;s
board of
directors, in Los Angeles, California, to get acquainted. Mr.&nbsp;Ford 
expressed his support of the senior management of Crimson, his enthusiasm for a 
potential combination but shared with Mr.&nbsp;Romano his inability to exchange 
Crimson&#146;s
second lien debt held by an affiliate of Oaktree Management for equity in the 
combined company based on structural limitations within the various Oaktree 
funds. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-
indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">On March&nbsp;11, 2013, Messrs. 
Keel and Grady met with Mr.&nbsp;Romano regarding the status of due diligence 
for each party. Each party&#146;s preliminary conclusion was that nothing 
material was
uncovered in diligence conducted to date that would alter the range of 
preliminary pro forma equity ownership previously discussed. </FONT></P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">On March 12, 2013, the Crimson 
board of directors held a regularly-scheduled quarterly meeting. At this 
meeting, a representative of Vinson &amp; Elkins provided a detailed 
presentation to the Crimson
board of directors on the duties of the directors in connection with strategic 
business combinations and other legal considerations relating to the proposed 
transaction, including the likelihood of litigation challenging the transaction.
Members of
management made presentations to the Crimson board of directors providing their 
view of the rationale for the proposed strategic combination with Contango, an 
overview of Contango&#146;s oil and gas properties, reserves and facilities and 
an
overview of Contango&#146;s current financial condition and the economics 
associated with the proposed merger. Representatives of Barclays also attended 
the meeting and made presentations to the Crimson board of directors regarding 
the
previously-requested review of various possible strategic alternatives for 
</FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">55 </FONT></P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2">
Crimson, which, as noted above, included (i)&nbsp;refinancing Crimson&#146;s 
current second lien credit facility; (ii)&nbsp;undertaking a private placement 
of equity capital, followed by a
refinancing of Crimson&#146;s second lien credit facility; (iii) undertaking a 
major recapitalization; (iv)&nbsp;pursuing a transformational acquisition; (v) 
raising capital through the sale of assets or (vi)&nbsp;pursuing a merger or 
sale of the
company. Barclays also presented to the Crimson board of directors their 
preliminary assessment of the possible merger with Contango as one of those 
alternatives, including discussion of the rationale for the transaction as the 
alternative that best
met Crimson&#146;s strategic objectives, a pro forma view of the combined 
company and its capitalization, and the relative valuations for each of Crimson 
and Contango. Barclays advised the Crimson board of directors of its view that 
Crimson needed
significant capital to take advantage of its drilling inventory and accelerate 
development of its assets, which could be challenging given Crimson&#146;s 
leverage and size. Barclays recommended that Crimson consider a merger with a 
better
capitalized company, a sale of the company or a recapitalization of the company.
Barclays noted preliminarily that the proposed merger with Contango would 
provide increased scale, asset diversification, capital to accelerate 
Crimson&#146;s capital
program, and a strong pro forma balance sheet. A representative of Vinson &amp; 
Elkins then provided the Crimson board of directors with an overview of the key 
terms of the initial draft of the merger agreement and noted provisions thereof 
which
concerned management and Vinson &amp; Elkins. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-
top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2">The Crimson board of directors and management then discussed the
strategic
alternatives exercise and the proposed Contango merger, and the comments made by
Crimson&#146;s advisors regarding the same. The Crimson board of directors was 
also aware of the various acquisition, divestiture, financing and strategic 
combination
discussions management had participated in with third parties in recent years. 
The Crimson board of directors concluded that a merger of Crimson was an 
attractive scenario compared to other possible strategic alternatives, and that 
the proposed
Contango merger, on the general preliminary terms previously discussed, would be
an excellent outcome for Crimson&#146;s stockholders. </FONT></P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The key factors behind Crimson 
management&#146;s recommendation for the proposed merger were: (i) the combined 
company would be very strong financially and would have access to the capital 
necessary to
realize the intrinsic value of Crimson&#146;s asset base, (ii) the merger 
structure would provide the mechanism for Crimson&#146;s existing stockholders 
to participate in the realization of the value to be derived from the 
company&#146;s asset base,
plus participate in the upside of Contango&#146;s potentially high impact Gulf 
of Mexico prospects and (iii) the combination would create a larger 
organization, with an expanded stockholder base and trading volume, that could 
contribute to a higher
market valuation multiple than either Contango or Crimson might command 
individually, each of which would enhance stockholder value. </FONT></P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">On March&nbsp;13, 2013, Crimson 
released its results for the fourth quarter and full year ended 
December&nbsp;31, 2012. Also on this date, Messrs. Isaac and Thomas participated
in a conference call with
representatives from Morgan Lewis to provide Morgan Lewis with an overview of 
the handling of environmental matters at Crimson. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">On March&nbsp;13, 2013, Contango engaged 
Longnecker and Associates (referred to in this joint proxy statement/prospectus 
as
&#147;Longnecker&#148;), as consultant in connection with compensation issues 
relating to the merger and the combined company. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">On March&nbsp;14, 2013, representatives of 
Crimson and TEAM met with representatives of Contango at Contango&#146;s offices
to begin a
diligence review of title to Contango&#146;s oil and gas properties and material
contracts relating thereto. This review continued for several weeks following 
this initial meeting. Also on this date, Mr.&nbsp;Isaac and Mr.&nbsp;Mike Autin,
Contango&#146;s Vice President &#150; Production, toured several of 
Contango&#146;s platforms located in the Gulf of Mexico. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">On March&nbsp;15, 2013, Mr.&nbsp;Grady met with
representatives of the lead bank of its existing bank group to initiate 
discussions on
potential financing alternatives, including the likelihood of an expanded senior
borrowing base for the combined company. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-
top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2">On
March&nbsp;16, 2013, Vinson&nbsp;&amp; Elkins distributed a revised draft merger
agreement to Morgan Lewis. Among other things, the revised merger agreement 
(i)&nbsp;required that certain Contango stockholders enter into
</FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">56 </FONT></P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2">
support agreements, (ii)&nbsp;enhanced the scope of the parties&#146; 
representations and warranties, (iii)&nbsp;made several substantive changes to 
the deal protection provisions including
adding more flexibility to the exceptions to the no-solicitation covenant, 
adding an ability of the boards of directors to change their recommendation for 
reasons other than a &#147;superior proposal&#148; and shortening the matching 
periods,
(iv)&nbsp;changed the post-closing governance provisions to provide the combined
company more flexibility, (v)&nbsp;changed the termination provisions, including
proposing a termination fee of 2.5% of the respective parties&#146; equity 
values for
&#147;superior proposals&#148; and 4% of the respective parties&#146; equity 
values for reasons other than a &#147;superior proposal&#148; and 
(vi)&nbsp;added an event-specific material adverse effect provision based on 
lost reserves or production
due to a casualty event. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-
bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" 
SIZE="2">On March&nbsp;18, 2013, Mr.&nbsp;Mengle met with representatives from 
Barclays to discuss reserve
information being used by Barclays for its evaluation. </FONT></P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Also on March&nbsp;18, 2013, Contango&#146;s 
board of directors held a
meeting at Contango offices. At the request of Contango&#146;s board, 
representatives from Morgan Lewis and Petrie were also in attendance. In advance
of the meeting, on March&nbsp;15, 2013, the board received materials regarding 
Crimson as well as
information regarding director fiduciary duties, drafts of the merger agreement 
and support agreement and various analyst reports. At this meeting, Petrie 
presented a preliminary analysis of the possible transaction, including a 
discussion of the
energy market environment, a profile of Crimson, a summary of illustrative deal 
terms as of that date, a preliminary reference value analysis summary, and a 
preliminary pro forma analysis. Mr.&nbsp;Juneau also reported on his review of
Crimson&#146;s oil and gas reserves. Representatives from Morgan Lewis then 
presented information regarding the directors&#146; fiduciary duties in 
considering a possible transaction, as well as the timetable for the possible 
transaction and the
diligence efforts in progress to understand possible obligations, liabilities or
contingent liabilities of a combined company. Mr.&nbsp;B.A. Berilgen, a member 
of the Contango board of directors, recommended that Contango engage an 
environmental
consultant to review potential environmental issues and plugging and abandonment
responsibilities of Crimson. After discussion, the Contango board of directors 
agreed that management should continue to examine Crimson and pursue discussions
regarding a possible transaction. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-
bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" 
SIZE="2">On March&nbsp;19, 2013, Messrs. Keel and Grady met with Mr.&nbsp;Romano
to discuss staffing
of the combined company, possible timing for signing of definitive agreements 
and certain open key business terms in the merger agreement, including the no-
shop provision, the &#147;material adverse effect&#148; closing condition, post-
closing
management structure, executive compensation, use of an investment committee and
certain deal protection provisions. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-
top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2">On
March&nbsp;20, 2013, Mr.&nbsp;Atkins met with Mr.&nbsp;John Miller of Juneau 
Exploration to review Contango&#146;s offshore prospect inventory. </FONT></P> 
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">On March&nbsp;21, 2013, 
Mr.&nbsp;Grady and Mr.&nbsp;Romano spoke via telephone regarding bonus and 
equity award plans and bifurcation of 2013 calendar year bonuses into pre-
closing and post-closing
periods. On this date, Messrs. Grady and Thomas also participated in a 
conference call with Mr.&nbsp;Romano, representatives from Morgan Lewis and 
representatives from Longnecker regarding Longnecker&#146;s review of 
compensation issues relating to
the merger and the combined company. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-
top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2">On March&nbsp;22, 2013, Messrs. Atkins, Mengle and Isaac met 
with Messrs. Romano, Juneau
and Johns of Juneau Exploration regarding Contango&#146;s Tuscaloosa Marine 
Shale position. On this date, Mr.&nbsp;Grady and Mr.&nbsp;Romano also discussed 
compensation issues and executive employment agreements. Mr.&nbsp;Grady also met
with
representatives of Deloitte on this date to discuss tax issues associated with 
the proposed business combination. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-
bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" 
SIZE="2">On

Contango&#146;s Vice President, Controller and Chief Accounting Officer, to 
discuss the transaction timeline and upcoming financial reporting obligations of
the parties. On this
date, Mr.&nbsp;Grady also met with representatives of Barclays to discuss the 
status of the valuation analysis being undertaken by Barclays. Mr.&nbsp;Grady 
and other Crimson representatives also met on this date with
</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2">
representatives of Opportune regarding diligence matters. On this date, 
Mr.&nbsp;Isaac, Mr.&nbsp;Thomas, other representatives of Crimson, 
representatives of Contango and representatives of CRA,
met in Crimson&#146;s offices to discuss the scope and timing of Contango&#146;s
environmental due diligence on Crimson&#146;s oil and gas properties. 
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Morgan Lewis provided a further 
revised draft merger agreement to Crimson and Vinson&nbsp;&amp; Elkins on 
March&nbsp;25, 2013. The revised merger agreement, among other things, 
(i)&nbsp;limited exceptions
to the no-solicitation covenant, (ii)&nbsp;lengthened the matching rights 
periods, (iii)&nbsp;changed the post-closing governance provisions to make them 
more open, (iv)&nbsp;changed the termination provisions, including proposing a 
termination fee
of 3% of each party&#146;s enterprise value and (v)&nbsp;eliminated the casualty
event material adverse effect provision proposed by Crimson. </FONT></P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">On March&nbsp;26, 2013, Messrs. 
Keel, Grady, Atkins, Isaac and Mengle met with various members of the Contango 
board of directors (including Messrs. Romano, Juneau, Reimer, Berilgen and 
Schoonover) to
become acquainted. Topics discussed included investment philosophies relating to
capital spending decisions. On this date, Mr.&nbsp;Grady also met with 
Mr.&nbsp;Romano regarding bonus plans, equity incentive plans and treatment of 
existing Crimson
equity-based incentive compensation grants in the merger. The Contango board of 
directors then held a meeting to discuss the status of the merger. At the 
request of the Contango board, representatives from Morgan Lewis also attended 
telephonically.
The Contango board members expressed favorable viewpoints on the senior officers
they had met. Mr.&nbsp;Romano and other members of Contango&#146;s operational 
staff then provided the Contango board with an update on CRA&#146;s 
environmental
inspection of Crimson&#146;s most valuable well properties. Representatives of 
Morgan Lewis then reported on the status of due diligence process, including a 
discussion on title to Crimson&#146;s most valuable wells and related oil and 
gas
agreements, pending litigation, employment arrangements and environmental 
matters. Morgan Lewis also described the draft merger agreement and the key 
business issues likely to arise under the agreement. Mr.&nbsp;Romano also 
described the discussions
regarding employment for senior executives of Crimson, including arrangements to
be approved by the Contango directors at the same time the merger agreement 
might be approved. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; 
text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">On March&nbsp;27, 2013, Messrs. 
Grady and Thomas participated in a conference call with representatives of 
Morgan Lewis to discuss Crimson&#146;s pending litigation. On this date, 
Mr.&nbsp;Grady also met
with Ms.&nbsp;Makalskaya to discuss Contango&#146;s retention of Duff&nbsp;&amp;
Phelps, LLC, to assist with accounting and tax due diligence and preliminary 
purchase price allocation for accounting purposes. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">From March&nbsp;27, 2013 through April&nbsp;3, 
2013, members of Crimson&#146;s senior management and representatives from
Vinson&nbsp;&amp; Elkins and Oaktree Management engaged in numerous discussions 
regarding the revised draft merger agreement. Vinson&nbsp;&amp; Elkins and 
Morgan Lewis continued to negotiate the transaction documents, with particular 
emphasis on
which stockholders would execute support agreements, whether either party could 
terminate absent a &#147;superior proposal,&#148; the size of termination fees 
and when those fees would be payable, post-closing governance matters and the 
casualty
event material adverse effect provision. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-
top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2">Between March&nbsp;28 and April&nbsp;2, 2013, representatives of
Crimson,
Vinson&nbsp;&amp; Elkins and Oaktree Management spoke by telephone on multiple 
occasions to discuss in general terms various provisions of the proposed merger 
agreement, including, but not limited to, termination fees, material adverse 
effect
provisions, conditions to closing, acceptable limits on pre-closing operating 
activity, representations and warranties of the parties and post-closing 
governance of the combined company. The desire for, and the acceptable form of, 
support agreements
for specific stockholders was also discussed. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-
top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2">On March&nbsp;28, 2013, Messrs. Keel and Grady met with 
Mr.&nbsp;Romano and
representatives from Longnecker regarding executive compensation trends for 
purposes of finalizing post-closing compensation structure for the combined
company&#146;s officers. On this date, Mr.&nbsp;Grady also had a conference call
with Jon Hughes,
a representative of Petrie, regarding the number and characteristic of stock 
options previously granted to Crimson employees. Mr.&nbsp;Grady and other 
representatives of Crimson also participated in a conference call with 
representatives of
Duff&nbsp;&amp; Phelps to discuss their review of Crimson. Vinson&nbsp;&amp; 
Elkins and Morgan Lewis </FONT></P>

to discuss various
outstanding business issues on the merger agreement, including deal protection 
issues such as the appropriate amounts for termination fees and the range of 
circumstances when such fees should be payable, social issues such as the

committee, etc. On this date, a representative of Crimson and a representative 
of CRA also met to facilitate Contango&#146;s continuing review of 
Crimson&#146;s environmental
records. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-
indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">On April&nbsp;3, 
2013, Mr.&nbsp;Grady, Mr.&nbsp;Romano and representatives of Petrie and Barclays
met to discuss
presentation of the combined company&#146;s pro forma financial and operational 
results and prospects, key terms of the transaction and timing of the 
transaction. Also on this day, Mr.&nbsp;Grady met with representatives of 
Opportune regarding
on-going due diligence efforts. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-
bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" 
SIZE="2">On April&nbsp;3, 2013, Vinson&nbsp;&amp; Elkins distributed a revised 
draft merger agreement
and form of support agreement to Morgan Lewis. Changes to the merger agreement 
included (i)&nbsp;permitting Contango to terminate for a &#147;superior 
proposal,&#148; (ii)&nbsp;a termination fee of $10 million for Crimson and $40 
million for
Contango (which amounts represented approximately 3% of the enterprise value of 
Crimson and 8% of the enterprise value of Contango, respectively, as of such 
date), (iii)&nbsp;payment of a termination fee if, in certain instances, a party
enters into
an alternative transaction within 12 months of termination, including certain 
buy-side transactions, (iv)&nbsp;requiring the combined company to adopt a bylaw
amendment that would require, for one year, a two-thirds majority of the 
combined company
board and at least one Crimson appointee to the combined company board to make
certain changes to the agreed-upon post-closing governance and (v)&nbsp;deleting
the requirement of a per se casualty event material adverse effect but 
eliminating a
natural disaster exception from the definition of material adverse effect. The 
form of support agreements provided that Oaktree, Allan D. Keel, Kenneth R. Peak
and Brad Juneau would execute support agreements. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">On April&nbsp;4, 2013, members of the 
management teams of each of Crimson and Contango, as well as representatives 
from Duff&nbsp;&amp;
Phelps and Deloitte participated in a conference call to provide Duff&nbsp;&amp;
Phelps with an opportunity to perform a diligence review of Crimson&#146;s tax 
characteristics. On this date Mr.&nbsp;Grady and Mr.&nbsp;Romano also spoke by 
telephone
to discuss staffing needs for the combined company. </FONT></P> <P

family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">On April&nbsp;8, 2013, Mr.&nbsp;Grady and 
Mr.&nbsp;Romano met to discuss
open issues on the employment agreements for Messrs. Keel and Grady (including 
tax gross-up language in their existing agreements and possible future clawback 
policies resulting from recent federal legislation) as well as other 
compensation and
staffing issues. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-
indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">On April&nbsp;9, 
2013, Morgan Lewis provided a further revised draft merger agreement and form of
support
agreement to Crimson and Vinson&nbsp;&amp; Elkins. Among other things, this 
draft of the merger agreement (i)&nbsp;provided detail regarding the post-
closing salaries and benefits of Contango employees, (ii)&nbsp;changed the 
termination fee to $10
million for Crimson and $20 million for Contango (which amounts represented 
approximately 3% of the enterprise value of Crimson and 4% of the enterprise 
value of Contango, respectively, as of such date) and (iii)&nbsp;reinserted the 
natural disaster
exception to the definition of material adverse effect. Contango proposed that 
Oaktree and all officers and directors of both parties execute support 
agreements. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-
indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">On April&nbsp;8 and 9, 2013, 
Mr.&nbsp;Isaac met with Contango&#146;s regulatory consultants to perform 
regulatory due diligence. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-
bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">On April&nbsp;9, 2013, 
Mr.&nbsp;Grady and Mr.&nbsp;Romano spoke by telephone to discuss open employment
agreement issues, compensation matters, the potential timeline for execution of 
the merger agreement
and preparation of a </FONT></P>

2013, the Contango
board of directors held a meeting at Contango&#146;s offices to receive an

also in

recent analysis of Contango&#146;s reserves at its Dutch Mary Rose property. The
Board discussed the analysis and the reserve report provided by Cobb&nbsp;&amp; 
Associates.
The Board heard presentations regarding potential environmental liabilities of 
Crimson&#146;s exploration and production business, accounting and tax 
assessments of Crimson and the possible combined company, Crimson&#146;s 
outstanding litigation,
updated preliminary reference value ranges for Contango and Crimson, the current

company. Morgan Lewis also provided an update to the board on the draft merger 
agreement,
support agreements and amendments to Contango&#146;s bylaws to the board.

STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">On April&nbsp;12, 2013, 
Vinson&nbsp;&amp; Elkins
sent a draft of the support agreement to be executed by Contango&#146;s officers
to Contango and Morgan Lewis. The draft support agreement was substantially
similar to the support agreement to be executed by Crimson&#146;s officers, 
except that such
support agreements could not be terminated upon a decrease in merger 
consideration or a change in the form of merger consideration. Vinson&nbsp;&amp;
Elkins, Morgan Lewis and Oaktree Management continued to negotiate the support 
agreements.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT 
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">On April&nbsp;12, 2013, Oaktree 
Management retained Kirkland&nbsp;&amp; Ellis LLP (referred to in this joint 
proxy
statement/prospectus as &#147;Kirkland&#148;) to negotiate a registration rights
agreement with Contango with respect to Oaktree&#146;s ownership of Contango 
common stock and other registerable securities upon closing of the potential 
merger.
Kirkland distributed an initial draft of the registration rights agreement on 
April&nbsp;13, 2013. From then until April&nbsp;25, 2013, Crimson, Contango, 
Oaktree Management and their legal counsel negotiated the terms of the 
registration rights
agreement. </FONT></P>

<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-

diligence memos from Opportune and Deloitte which
did not identify any material issues relating to the proposed merger with 
Contango. In addition, Mr.&nbsp;Mengle met with a representative of

field. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-

information as well as open issues on the employment agreements for Messrs. Keel

Mr.&nbsp;Romano also met to discuss status and open issues on the merger

STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">On April&nbsp;16, 2013, Contango 
provided Crimson with the revised estimates of its offshore proved reserves as 
of
December&nbsp;31, 2012. Based upon an analysis of additional pressure data 
performed by Cobb&nbsp;&amp; Associates, Contango&#146;s estimates of gross 
original gas in place, implied gross recoverable reserves and net proved 
reserves were adjusted
downward. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-
indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">On April&nbsp;16, 
2013, Morgan Lewis distributed a revised draft of the merger agreement and 
ancillary agreements
to Crimson and Vinson&nbsp;&amp; Elkins. On April&nbsp;17, 2013, Crimson 
management, Vinson&nbsp;&amp; Elkins and Morgan Lewis discussed Morgan 
Lewis&#146; revisions to the merger agreement by telephone. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">On April&nbsp;19, 2013, Mr.&nbsp;Grady and 
Mr.&nbsp;Romano met to discuss the adjustments to Contango&#146;s reserves 
resulting from
recent production information and any potential changes to the relative value of
both companies. Mr.&nbsp;Romano and Mr.&nbsp;Grady agreed that each party&#146;s
financial advisors should update their work to reflect the adjustments to
Contango&#146;s reserves, new commodity prices and other additional information.
Following the meeting Mr.&nbsp;Grady asked Barclays to update its analysis to 
include recent reserve adjustments as well as more recent commodity prices and 
other newly
provided valuation information. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-
bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" 
SIZE="2">On April&nbsp;20, 2013, Kenneth R. Peak, Contango&#146;s founder and 
Chairman, passed away
and the parties temporarily suspended negotiations. </FONT></P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">On April&nbsp;22, 2013, Mr.&nbsp;Grady and 
Mr.&nbsp;Romano met to discuss
outstanding issues that could possibly impact the equity split, including 
changes in oil and natural gas prices, further due diligence on changes in 
certain working capital items (including proceeds from a key man life insurance 
policy),
reevaluation of exposure risk on certain contingencies and recent operational 
activity (including the revised estimates of offshore proved reserves) that 
impacted previous assumptions and outstanding issues on the merger agreement 
including, but not
limited to, termination fees, material adverse effect provisions, conditions to 
closing and acceptable limits on pre-closing activity. Mr.&nbsp;Romano indicated
that Contango and its advisors were of the opinion that the preliminary 80/20 
equity
ownership split continued to be appropriate, subject to the completion of final 
due diligence, as some of the issues raised by Mr. Grady were subjective in 
nature. In addition, Mr. Romano indicated Contango&#146;s confidence that its 
investments in
Alta and Exaro could be worth more than the invested capital reflected on its 
balance sheet based on discussions with its equity partners, which had not 
previously been considered in the determination of the equity ownership split. 
Each party agreed
to provide the other with additional supporting documentation following the 
meeting. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-
indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">On April&nbsp;23, 
2013, Messrs. Keel and
Grady met with Mr.&nbsp;Romano to discuss the equity split, the status of open 
issues on the merger agreement, employment agreements for Messrs. Keel and Grady
and the registration rights agreement between Contango and affiliates of Oaktree
Management. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-
indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">On April&nbsp;24, 
2013, the Contango board of directors held a meeting at Contango&#146;s offices.
At the request
of the Contango board, representatives from Morgan Lewis and Petrie also 
attended the meeting. The directors </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">61 </FONT></P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2">
discussed Crimson&#146;s drilling program and Contango&#146;s updated production
results. The directors also received an update on the due diligence process and 
key remaining issues in the merger
documentation. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-
indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Also on 
April&nbsp;24, 2013, Vinson&nbsp;&amp; Elkins circulated a revised draft of the 
merger agreement to
Contango and Morgan Lewis. Morgan Lewis distributed a further revised draft of 
the merger agreement and the various ancillary agreements on April&nbsp;25, 
2013. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-
indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">On April&nbsp;25, 2013, 
Mr.&nbsp;Keel met with Mr.&nbsp;Romano to continue their discussion regarding 
the equity split, and they agreed upon a 79.7/20.3% equity split taking into 
account a number of
factors and information raised by both Crimson and Contango related to due 
diligence results and recent events, including changes in oil and natural gas 
prices, further due diligence on changes in certain working capital items 
(including proceeds
from a key man life insurance policy), reevaluation of exposure risk on certain 
contingencies (including the revised estimates of offshore proved reserves) and 
recent information on operational activity that impacted previous assumptions 
(including
the revised estimates of offshore proved reserves) and information regarding 
Contango&#146;s investments in Exaro and Alta. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">On April&nbsp;25, 2013, Mr.&nbsp;Romano 
obtained an order appointing him as the temporary administrator of the Estate of
Mr.&nbsp;Peak
from a probate court in Harris County, Texas, granting Mr.&nbsp;Romano the 
authority to execute a support agreement on behalf of the Estate of 
Mr.&nbsp;Peak. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-
indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In the morning of April&nbsp;27, 
2013, representatives of both parties and counsel met telephonically to discuss 
final issues on the merger agreement and ancillary agreements. Additionally, the
parties
finalized the ancillary agreements and discussed the remaining steps to be 
completed prior to signing the merger agreement. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In the afternoon of April&nbsp;27, 2013, the 
Crimson board of directors met telephonically with certain members of 
Crimson&#146;s senior
management team, as well as with representatives from Vinson&nbsp;&amp; Elkins 
and Barclays. Management provided members of the board with an update on 
(1)&nbsp;the status of the transaction including remaining open items including 
diligence
associated with recently identified material contracts, (2)&nbsp;prior 
discussions regarding recent production and pressure test data from certain of 
Contango&#146;s wells and the implications thereof, (3)&nbsp;Contango&#146;s 
efforts to work-over
its Vermillion 170 well and (4)&nbsp;recent discussions between the parties 
regarding the equity split for the transaction. A representative from 
Vinson&nbsp;&amp; Elkins then provided members of the board with a reminder 
regarding their fiduciary
duties in connection with the proposed transaction. Representatives of Barclays 
provided an updated report regarding the proposed merger wherein they reviewed 
the rationale for the transaction, the benefits to each party&#146;s 
stockholders, an
analysis of the proposed exchange ratio and the premium associated therewith, 
and the various valuation analyses undertaken by Barclays. A representative from
Vinson&nbsp;&amp; Elkins also reviewed with the board the terms of the near-
final merger
agreement, including changes to which the parties had agreed since the 
board&#146;s March&nbsp;12th meeting. Following these discussions, the Crimson 
board authorized members of Crimson&#146;s senior management to finalize the 
remaining open items
and indicated that, assuming the remaining items could be satisfactorily 
resolved, they were prepared to approve the transaction. </FONT></P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">During the afternoon of 
April&nbsp;29, 2013, the Contango board of directors met with certain 
representatives from Morgan Lewis and Petrie. Mr.&nbsp;Romano provided the board
with a status update on the
merger agreement and ancillary documents related thereto and indicated that all 
issues with Crimson had been resolved. In connection with consideration by the 
Contango board of directors of the proposed strategic combination with Crimson, 
Petrie
delivered its oral opinion that, as of that date, the exchange ratio set forth 
in the merger agreement was fair, from a financial point of view, to Contango 
(as more fully described under &#147;&#151; Opinion of Contango&#146;s Financial
Advisors&#148;), Petrie later delivered to Contango its written opinion dated 
April&nbsp;29, 2013. Following these discussions, the Contango board of 
directors determined that the merger agreement and the transactions contemplated
thereby were fair
to, and in the best interests of, Contango and its stockholders and authorized 
Contango management to execute the merger agreement and ancillary documents on 
behalf of Contango. In connection with the merger, Contango&#146;s board also 
authorized
the registration rights agreement, </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">62 </FONT></P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2">
support agreements, employment agreements with Messrs. Keel and Grady and 
amendments to Contango&#146;s bylaws as contemplated in the merger agreement. 
</FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Also during the afternoon on April&nbsp;29, 
2013, the Crimson board of directors met telephonically with certain members of
Crimson&#146;s senior management team and representatives from Barclays. 
Management provided the board with a status update on merger agreement, 
ancillary documents relating thereto and indicated that all material issues had 
been resolved. In
connection with consideration by the Crimson board of directors of the proposed 
strategic combination with Contango, Barclays delivered its oral opinion that, 
as of that date, the exchange ratio set forth in the merger agreement was fair, 
from a
financial point of view, to the holders of shares of Crimson common stock (as 
more fully described under &#147;&#151; Opinion of Crimson&#146;s Financial 
Advisors&#148;). Following these discussions, the Crimson board adopted the 
merger agreement
and determined that the merger agreement and the transactions contemplated 
thereby, including the merger, were advisable and in the best interests of 
Crimson and its stockholders and the members present unanimously voted to 
approve the merger
agreement and the transactions contemplated thereby. Mr.&nbsp;Ni Zhaoxing was
not present at such board meeting (although his representative did attend as an 
approved observer), but subsequently ratified the actions taken by the Crimson 
board of
directors. Barclays later delivered to Crimson its written opinion dated 
April&nbsp;29, 2013. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; 
text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In the 
evening of
April&nbsp;29, 2013, Contango and Crimson senior management and their respective
legal counsel, having resolved the remaining open items, finalized the 
disclosure schedules, ancillary documents and announcement documents, and made 
certain final,
non-substantive corrections to the merger agreement. Shortly thereafter, members
of Crimson senior management and Contango senior management, advised by their 
respective legal counsels, executed the merger agreement and ancillary 
agreements.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT 
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Early in the morning on 
April&nbsp;30, 2013, Contango and Crimson issued a joint press release 
announcing the merger and
hosted a joint conference call for the investment community to explain the 
specific details of the proposed merger. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-
top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" 
SIZE="2"><B><A NAME="toc548164_53">
</A>Contango&#146;s Reasons for the Merger; Recommendation of the Contango Board
of Directors </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-
indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In approving the 
merger
agreement and recommending approval of the issuance of shares of Contango common
stock to Crimson stockholders in connection with the merger, the Contango board 
of directors consulted with members of Contango&#146;s management, as well as 
with
Contango&#146;s legal, financial and other advisors, and also considered a 
number of factors that the Contango board of directors viewed as bearing on its 
decisions. The principal factors that the Contango board of directors viewed as 
supporting its
decisions were: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-
bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" 
CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times 
New Roman" SIZE="2">that Crimson&#146;s lower-risk, unconventional development 
portfolio complements Contango&#146;s higher-potential, offshore prospects;
</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-
bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" 
CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times 
New Roman" SIZE="2">that Contango&#146;s liquidity complements Crimson&#146;s 
lower-risk, operated liquids-focused proved drilling portfolio and resource 
upside;
</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-
bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" 
CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New
Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times 
New Roman" SIZE="2">that the combined company will have over 1 trillion cubic 
feet equivalents of resource potential in offshore and onshore locations 
including the
Woodbine, Eagle Ford, Buda, James Lime and Niobrara plays; 
</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-
bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" 
CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times 
New Roman" SIZE="2">the opportunity to integrate the well-respected knowledge 
base, potential transaction flow and execution capabilities of Crimson&#146;s 
management team
into that of Contango&#146;s, particularly in light of the recent passing of 
Contango&#146;s founder and former Chairman and Chief Executive Officer, Kenneth
R. Peak, and the ensuing succession planning undertaken by the Contango board of
directors;
</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-
bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" 
CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times 
New Roman" SIZE="2">that Crimson&#146;s sizeable staff and existing internal 
systems will allow the combined company to quickly and efficiently handle the 
increased asset
base and operational burdens; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-
size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" 
CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times 
New Roman" SIZE="2">that the merger will be strongly accretive to 
Contango&#146;s cash flow and reserves per share; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" 
CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times 
New Roman" SIZE="2">that the net operating loss of approximately $110 million of
Crimson may be utilized by the combined company in future years subject to 
limitations
contained in Section&nbsp;382 of the Code; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P 
STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" 
CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times 
New Roman" SIZE="2">the strong to-date drilling results of Crimson and other 
operators in the Woodbine and Buda formations; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">63 </FONT></P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" 
CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times 
New Roman" SIZE="2">that the combined company will be significantly larger than 
Contango is now and as a result should have greater exploration and production 
strengths,
greater liquidity in the market for its securities and better ability to 
consider future strategic opportunities that might not otherwise be possible; 
</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-
bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" 
CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times 
New Roman" SIZE="2">the expectation that the combined company will be able to 
accelerate development of additional exploration and development opportunities 
and achieve
exploration and production drilling efficiencies; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> 
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" 
CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times 
New Roman" SIZE="2">the opportunity to double Contango&#146;s current oil 
production and proved oil reserves; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" 
CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times 
New Roman" SIZE="2">that the combination of Contango and Crimson will preserve 
significant strategic continuity for both companies and employee continuity for 
Crimson;
</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-
bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" 
CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times 
New Roman" SIZE="2">the terms and conditions of the merger agreement, including 
the commitments by both Contango and Crimson to complete the merger and certain 
reciprocal
provisions that may have the effect of discouraging alternative acquisition 
proposals involving Crimson or Contango, and the likelihood of completing the 
merger; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" 
CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times 
New Roman" SIZE="2">the fact that the merger agreement does not preclude a third
party from making an unsolicited proposal for a competing transaction with 
Contango or
Crimson and, that under certain circumstances more fully described in the 
sections &#147;The Merger Agreement &#151; No Solicitation of Alternative 
Proposals&#148; beginning on page 117 and &#147;The Merger Agreement &#151; 
Changes in Board
Recommendations&#148; beginning on page 118, Contango or Crimson, as applicable,
may furnish non-public information to and enter into discussions with such third
party regarding the competing transaction and the Contango or Crimson board, as
applicable, may withdraw or modify its recommendations to Contango or Crimson 
stockholders regarding the merger; and </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P 
STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" 
CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times 
New Roman" SIZE="2">the opinion of Petrie, dated April&nbsp;29, 2013, to the 
Contango board of directors to the effect that, as of that date and based on and
subject to
various assumptions, qualifications and limitations described in the Petrie 
opinion included with this joint proxy statement/prospectus as Annex B, the 
exchange ratio of 0.08288 shares of Contango common stock to be issued by 
Contango in exchange
for each outstanding share of Crimson common stock pursuant to the merger was 
fair, from a financial point of view, to Contango, as more fully described below
under the caption &#147;&#151; Opinion of Contango&#146;s Financial Advisors 
&#151;
Opinion of Petrie Partners, LLC.&#148; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Contango board of directors weighed the 
foregoing against a
number of potentially negative factors, including: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-
size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" 
CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times 
New Roman" SIZE="2">the restrictions on the conduct of Contango&#146;s business 
during the period between the execution of the merger agreement and the 
completion of the
merger as set forth in the merger agreement; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P 
STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" 
CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times 
New Roman" SIZE="2">the costs associated with the completion of the merger, 
including management&#146;s time and energy and potential opportunity cost;
</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-
bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" 
CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times 
New Roman" SIZE="2">the amount of indebtedness of Crimson and the annual debt 
service costs of such indebtedness; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" 
CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times 
New Roman" SIZE="2">the challenges in absorbing the effect of any failure to 
complete the merger, including potential termination fees and stockholder and 
market
reactions; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-
top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" 
CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times 
New Roman" SIZE="2">the potential earnings dilution to Contango stockholders 
following the merger; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" 
CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times 
New Roman" SIZE="2">the challenges inherent in the combination of two businesses
of the size and complexity of Contango and Crimson, including the possible 
diversion of
management attention for an extended period of time; 
</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-
bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" 
CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times 
New Roman" SIZE="2">the risk of not being able to realize all of the anticipated
cost savings and operational synergies between Contango and Crimson and the risk
that
other anticipated benefits might not be realized; and 
</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-
bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" 
CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times 
New Roman" SIZE="2">the risks of the type and nature described under &#147;Risk 
Factors,&#148; beginning on page 32 and the matters described under 
&#147;Special Note
Regarding Forward-Looking Statements&#148; beginning on page 30. 
</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-
indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">This discussion of
the information and
factors considered by Contango&#146;s board of directors in reaching its 
conclusions and recommendation includes the principal factors considered by the 
board, but is not intended to be </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">64 </FONT></P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2">
exhaustive and may not include all of the factors considered by the Contango 
board of directors. In view of the wide variety of factors considered in 
connection with its evaluation of the merger
and the other transactions contemplated by the merger agreement, and the 
complexity of these matters, the Contango board of directors did not find it 
useful and did not attempt to quantify, rank or assign any relative or specific 
weights to the
various factors that it considered in reaching its determination to approve the 
merger and the other transactions contemplated by the merger agreement, and to 
make its recommendation to Contango stockholders. Rather, the Contango board of 
directors
viewed its decisions as being based on the totality of the information presented
to it and the factors it considered, including its discussions with, and 
questioning of, members of Contango&#146;s management and outside legal and 
financial advisors.
In addition, individual members of the Contango board of directors may have 
assigned different weights to different factors. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Certain of Contango&#146;s directors and 
executive officers may have financial interests in the merger that are different
from, or in
addition to, those of Contango&#146;s stockholders generally. The Contango board
of directors was aware of and considered these potential interests, among other 
matters, in evaluating the merger and in making its recommendation to Contango
stockholders. For a discussion of these interests, see &#147;&#151; Interests of
Contango Directors and Executive Officers in the Merger.&#148; </FONT></P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>The Contango board of directors 
unanimously approved the merger and the merger agreement and determined that the
merger and the other transactions contemplated by the merger agreement, 
including the
issuance of shares of Contango common stock to Crimson stockholders in 
connection with the merger, are in the best interests of Contango and its 
stockholders. Accordingly, the Contango board of directors unanimously 
recommends that the Contango
stockholders vote &#147;FOR&#148; the proposal to approve the issuance of shares
of Contango common stock to Crimson stockholders pursuant to the merger. 
</B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><A 
NAME="toc548164_54"></A>Opinion of Contango&#146;s Financial Advisor 
</B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I>Opinion of Petrie Partners Securities, 
LLC to the Contango Board of Directors </I></B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In connection with the merger, on 
February&nbsp;13, 2013, the Contango board of directors retained Petrie to act 
as financial advisor to
the Contango board of directors. On April&nbsp;29, 2013, at a meeting of the 
Contango board of directors, Petrie rendered its oral opinion, subsequently 
confirmed by delivery of a written opinion soon after the meeting, that, as of 
April&nbsp;29,
2013 and based upon and subject to the factors, procedures, assumptions, 
qualifications and limitations set forth in its opinion, the exchange ratio was 
fair, from a financial point of view, to Contango. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>The full text of the written opinion of 
Petrie, dated as of April&nbsp;29, 2013, which sets forth, among other things, 
the procedures
followed, assumptions made, matters considered and qualifications and 
limitations on the scope of review undertaken in rendering its opinion, is 
attached as Annex B to this proxy statement/prospectus and is incorporated by 
reference in its entirety
into this proxy statement/prospectus. You are urged to read the opinion 
carefully and in its entirety. Petrie&#146;s opinion was addressed to, and 
provided for the information and benefit of, the Contango board of directors (in
its capacity as such)
in connection with its evaluation of whether the exchange ratio was fair, from a
financial point of view, to Contango. Petrie&#146;s opinion does not address the
fairness of the proposed merger, or any consideration received in connection 
with the
proposed merger, to the holders of any securities, creditors or other 
constituencies of Contango, nor does it address the fairness of the amount or 
nature of any compensation to be paid or payable to any of the officers, 
directors or employees of
Contango, or any class of such persons, whether relative to the exchange ratio 
or otherwise. Petrie assumed that any modification to the structure of the 
merger would not vary in any respect material to its analysis. Petrie&#146;s 
opinion does not
address the relative merits of the merger as compared to any other alternative 
business transaction or strategic alternative that might be available to 
Contango, nor does it address the underlying business decision of Contango to 
engage in the
merger. Petrie&#146;s opinion does not constitute a recommendation to the 
Contango board of directors or to any other persons in respect of the merger, 
including as to how any holder of shares of voting common stock of Contango 
should act or vote in
respect of any of the transactions contemplated by the merger </B></FONT></P>
<p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">65 </FONT></P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>

Roman" SIZE="2"><B>
agreement. Finally, Petrie did not express any opinion as to the price at which 
shares of Contango or Crimson common stock will trade at any time. 
</B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In connection with rendering its opinion and 
performing its related financial analysis, Petrie, among other things: 
</FONT></P>

</FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In connection with its analysis and opinion, 
Petrie assumed and relied upon, without assuming any responsibility or liability
for or
independently verifying the accuracy and completeness of, all of the information
publicly available and all of the information supplied or otherwise made 
available to Petrie by Contango and Crimson. Petrie further relied upon the 
assurances of
representatives of the respective managements of Contango and Crimson that they 
are unaware of any facts that would make the information provided to Petrie 
incomplete or misleading in any material respect. With respect to the projected 
financial and
operating data relating to Contango and Crimson referred to above, Petrie 
assumed that such data had been reasonably prepared on bases </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
